description: Ancient Greek ἐπί (epí, “upon”) + θήκη (thḗkē, “case, box, receptacle”)

entries.meaning: (microbiology, planktology) The upper half of the theca of a thecate protist such as a diatom or dinoflagellate.
examples: The diatom frustule is often likened to a pill-box ... with an epitheca (larger upper valve), and a hypotheca (smaller lower valve).
